alert.note: Alert for New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 29 at 10:15PM EDT until October 01 at 12:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern Connecticut, including the following county, New Haven. * WHEN...Until 1245 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1015 PM EDT, Flooding along the Pomperaug River continues due to heavy rainfall from earlier. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area in the next few hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Southbury. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
